title: Footwear Customs Broker
description:
**Customs Broker**

**Responsibilities:**

* **Identify HTS Codes:**
* Use advanced analytical tools and databases to ensure accurate HTS classification.
* Engage in continuous training to stay updated with changes in the General Rules of Interpretation.
* **Maintain Compliance:**
* Develop and implement compliance strategies to ensure adherence to CBP and other government regulations.
* Collaborate with legal teams to address compliance issues proactively.
* **Update Classification Database:**
* Regularly audit the Harmonized Classification Database to ensure data integrity.
* Implement automation for database updates to reduce manual errors.
* **Properly Classify Products:**
* Conduct detailed analysis of product specifications, IFI, and physical samples to determine correct HTS codes.
* Engage with product development teams to understand new product lines and their classification requirements.
* **Ensure Compliance with U.S. Import Regulations:**
* Lead compliance training sessions for internal teams to ensure everyone is aware of import regulations.
* Develop comprehensive checklists and guidelines for import compliance.
* **Follow Internal Controls:**
* Implement a robust internal audit process to regularly review compliance with import/export regulations.
* Develop key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of internal controls.
* **Perform Periodic Audits:**
* Use advanced data analytics to identify trends and potential areas of non-compliance in import/export transactions.
* Report audit findings to senior management with recommendations for corrective actions.

**Additional Responsibilities:**

* **Vendor and Supplier Management:**
* Work closely with vendors and suppliers to ensure they comply with all U.S. import regulations.
* Conduct periodic assessments of vendor compliance practices.
* **Documentation Management:**
* Oversee the preparation and submission of all required documentation for import/export activities.
* Ensure accurate record-keeping and archiving of all compliance-related documents.
* **Risk Management:**
* Develop and implement risk management strategies to mitigate potential compliance risks.
* Conduct regular risk assessments and update risk management plans accordingly.

**Additional Required Experience:**

* **Advanced Analytical Skills:**
* Proficiency in using data analytics tools to analyze and interpret complex data sets related to import/export activities.
* Experience with predictive analytics for compliance forecasting.
* **Project Management:**
* Proven experience in managing large-scale compliance projects from initiation to completion.
* Certification in project management (e.g., PMP) is a plus.
* **Legal Knowledge:**
* Basic understanding of international trade law and its implications on import/export activities.
* Experience working with legal teams to resolve compliance issues.
* **Communication Skills:**
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively interact with internal teams, vendors, and regulatory authorities.
* Experience in drafting compliance reports and presenting findings to senior management.
* **Technical Proficiency:**
* Advanced proficiency in customs compliance software and tools.
* Experience with ERP systems other than Blue Cherry is a plus.
* **Must have footwear experience**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Adjunct Research and Instruction Librarian
description:
Job Department/School **University Libraries**FT/PT/Temp **Part time**Location **Hauppauge Center**
  
Location: Adelphi University- Hauppauge Center Library and Garden City Swirbul Library

  

Hours: Part-time -up to 25 hours a week, split between both locations as needed  

(predicted Fall 2024 Hours at Hauppauge Center: Monday and Wednesday 3-10pm\\*, Garden City Hours tbd - will be determined by Undergraduate Nursing requests)



Salary: $40/hr

  

The Adelphi University Libraries are seeking an Adjunct Librarian to assist in the daily operations of the  

Hauppauge Center Library. This position has a dual role, working at the Hauppauge Center library supporting  

the needs of our Hauppauge Center students and faculty, and also serving as a liaison to the Adelphi  

University Undergraduate Nursing program based in our Garden City location. The incumbent will provide both  

remote and in-person assistance and Information Literacy Instruction.

  

The appointment will begin for the Fall semester, with a weekly workload of up to 25 hours. The position will  

report to the Dean of Libraries, and work closely with the Librarian Chair, the Dean’s administrative office, and  

other library departments. The exact weekly schedule will depend upon the needs of the Hauppauge Center\\*  

and Undergraduate Nursing courses, as determined by the Dean of University Libraries.

  

Key Responsibilities  

1. Oversee Day-to-Day Operations:


* Responsible for the day-to-day operations and services at the Hauppauge Center


Library. Create a welcoming environment for students and faculty to gather and make  

the library an exciting place to work or drop in for research assistance.  

* Work closely with the Hauppauge Center administration, faculty and staff.
* Align in-person schedule with the class schedule of the Center.\\*



2. Academic Outreach and Collaboration:


* Communicate with and provide outreach to assigned academic departments.
* Collaborate with colleagues from Garden City, Hudson Valley, and New York centers to


further the educational mission of the Adelphi University Libraries.

3. Research Support and Resources:


* Provide in person and virtual Information Literacy Instruction.
* Create online subject guides and other course-specific research resources for


undergraduate Nursing or other assigned subject areas.  

* Participate in the Libraries’ chat reference service.
* Conduct virtual and in-person research consultations for faculty and students.
* Review requests for purchases and electronic subscriptions, sharing insights with the


Collection Strategies Librarian.

Requirements  

* MLS/ MLIS or related degree from an ALA-accredited graduate program.
* Strong management, technology, and organizational abilities.
* At least one year of information literacy teaching experience (Nursing or Social Work preferred).
* Ability to work effectively and collegially with a diverse population of faculty, students, and staff.


Applying  

Interested candidates should apply online.



Locations  

* Hauppauge Center Library: 150 Motor Parkway, Hauppauge, NY 11788
* Swirbul Library: 1 South Ave, Garden City, NY 11530

* Note: The current anticipated class schedule for Fall 2024 is Monday and Wednesday in-person classes from


3 pm-10 pm in Hauppauge. These courses are dependent upon final registration and vary each semester.  

Undergraduate Nursing responsibilities in Garden City will be at the professor's or student's request.

title: PT Sales Associate-2
description:
We are an American luxury lifestyle brand, founded in 2004. Anchored in the casual elegance of American sportswear, Tory’s design philosophy is defined by effortless silhouettes, innovative materials, eclectic juxtapositions of color, and the tension of past and present. The collections include ready-to-wear, handbags, footwear, accessories, jewelry, home and beauty.
Empowering women is the company’s guiding principle, expressed through Tory’s collections and reflected in the company culture as well as the work of the Tory Burch Foundation. Established in 2009, the Foundation provides women entrepreneurs in the United States with capital, education and community.
You are seeking a work environment where people are encouraged to dream, explore, discover and, as important, laugh together. If you’re prepared to work hard, create impact, and have fun while doing it, we would love to have you join #TeamTory. Apply today!
Life @ToryBurch is Special Because:
When you join us, you’re joining a purpose-led company on an exciting growth journey with the best Retail Team in the industry.
Our culture is welcoming and inclusive * - everyone is empowered to make a difference.
* We have the best team in the world and believe in paying competitively and rewarding high performance.
* Your overall well-being is important to us; we offer benefits to help you take care of your mental and physical health, create financial security, and achieve wellness in all areas of your life.
* We love seeing our employees wear our beautiful collections. You’ll receive a generous employee discount and access to exclusive special offers.
* We will help you become great at what you love - Our Retail Excellence Programs in Styling, Coaching, Brand Ambassador (just to name a few) and supportive Retail Leaders are there to support you each step of the way
* We believe in the importance of giving back and you’ll have many opportunities to do just that through the Tory Burch Foundation and paid volunteer days.


This Role is Tailor-Made for You Because:
You are passionate about delivering a transformational client experience, building our brand one customer at a time and driving business through sales. You demonstrate a strong commitment to service, a genuine curiosity and interest in people, authenticity, fashion & style sensibility, and exceptional selling skills. You’re also resourceful and collaborative – a team player who is savvy about the visual and operational aspects of the role and committed to loss prevention. A sense of humor is a plus!
A Day in the Life:
The typical day is… atypical. You might be building and maintaining new and existing customer relationships to drive the business and meet personal sales goals, creating the customer experience through use of selling skills and extensive product knowledge, understanding and communicating the Tory Burch brand philosophy and lifestyle with each other and the customer while ensuring all sales and operational policies and procedures are followed and maintained. The consistent thread is that you’ll be working with an amazing team of women and men who share your passion for excellence.
To Land This Role:* One-to-three years’ experience in a high volume, customer-driven retail environment
* Strong personal selling and customer relations experience, along with verbal and written communication skills
* Must have open availability for a flexible work schedule that meets the needs of the business, including overnights, evenings, holidays and weekend shifts
* Ability to lift (at least 40 lbs), carry, push, pull, squat, kneel, twist, turn, climb ladders, crawl, reach, bend and stand for extended periods of time


Why You’ll Want to Join Our Team:
Our Retail Teams are known for making every customer feel welcome and creating the most memorable experiences for them. They help to grow our business every single day. Our store teams are encouraged to think like entrepreneurs and to experiment with innovative ideas that make it easier for them to deliver retail excellence. Come join us!
How We Work Together* Adaptable – We change before we have to
* Entrepreneurial – We own it
* Collaborative – There’s no “I” in Tory
* Client & Brand Focused – We put ourselves in Tory’s shoes
* Live the Values – We show up for each other
* Functional Expertise – We’re constantly learning and growing


#TeamTory Values
We show up with honesty & kindness, act with integrity & compassion, work with passion & humility and lead with excellence & humor.
Compensation Range
The compensation range for this position is 15.00 USD - 21.00 USD. Our offer will be based on your relevant experience and work location.
Benefits Information
We offer a generous set of benefits to help you take care of your health, create financial security, and achieve wellness in all areas of your life. Here are highlights of key benefits available to all Tory Burch members that work over 30 hours.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Tory Burch LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to an individual’s age, race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy) or sexual orientation, gender expression, military status, marital status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, disability or membership in any other protected class under applicable law. Likewise, we will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Ordinance No. 184652. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records for employment.
Disability Accommodation
Tory Burch is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require assistance or an accommodation with the hiring process, please contact thetalentteam@toryburch.com.

title: Production Manager
description:
**Job Description** **Come Join the SIXT JFK Airport Team, Production Manager salary $73,422 & Bonus annually $30,000-$37,000 & Company Car. Fleet Manager Experience, Service Manager, Rental Car Manager.**


As a Production Manager you will be responsible for managing the vehicle distribution and turnaround processes at the airport branch. Working in conjunction with the General manager to ensure vehicle safety, cleanliness and availability in a timely manner to meet customer demands and drive rental growth. The production manager is also responsible for managing the work environment and vendor relationships as well as driving efficiencies and reduce costs.

**General Duties and Responsibilities**

* Analyze KPIs and expenses to identify and implement processes and procedures to improve efficiency and reduce cost.
* Develop and manage efficient turnaround processes.
* Build & establish relationships with Branch Managers, staff, Service Providers, and vendors.
* Establish and communicate daily vehicle needs to the vendors on vehicle turnaround/ movements.
* Create weekly forecast for subcontractor needs to support cleaning and vehicle movement processes.
* Manage the process of cleaning and servicing vehicles at the QTA to ensure smooth operation of fleet movement from return to ready line.
* Ensure quality control by performing vehicle inspection to review subcontractor performance.
* Constant communication with the Branch management team to understand logistics needed and support the Fleet Planners in ensuring the subcontractors are working to meet our vehicle reservation demands.
* Quickly investigate and work with Fleet Planners/Customer service agents to resolve operational/ customer problems as they arise.
* Perform daily game plan meetings with Subcontractor managers, Fleet department and Fleet planners/Customer service agents.
* Coordinate movement of vehicles to and from overflow lots.
* Manage driver activity to ensure that maintenance vehicles are moved to the best location to maximize lot space and traffic flow.
* Act as the point of contact for the driver team on a daily basis. Act as a point of contact for Managers to get specific upgrade vehicles for customers.

 **Qualifications** **Qualifications**

* Experience in car rental industry preferred.
* Process oriented with proven record of success in managing large scale operational teams
* Exceptional communication skills (multiple languages fluent preferred)
* Expert issue resolution and efficient handling of complaints
* Flexible and resilient
* Organizational skills
* Self-confident & responsible
* High level of empathy

  

**Additional Information** **About us:**


We are a leading global mobility service provider with sales of €3.07 billion and around 7,500 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (cab, driver and chauffeur services), SIXT+ (car subscription) and gives our customers access to our fleet of 270,894 vehicles, the services of 1,500 cooperation partners and around 1.5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,098 rental stations. At SIXT, a first-class customer experience and outstanding customer service are our top priorities. We focus on true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Want to take off with us and revolutionize the world of mobility? Apply now!

**About the department:**  

As a mobility service provider, our Branches & Operations division is the point of contact with our customers: whether by phone, app or directly in our SIXT branches. This means: premium service directly to the customer, advice and sales in exchange and responsibility for the rental process of our premium fleet. As part of a team, it is easier to explain our products, find the best solution for the customer and manage the day-to-day business.


**About us:**  

We are a leading global mobility service provider with sales of €3.07 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (cab, driver and chauffeur services), SIXT+ (car subscription) and gives our customers access to our fleet of 222,000 vehicles, the services of 1,500 cooperation partners and around 1.5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,098 rental stations. At SIXT, a first-class customer experience and outstanding customer service are our top priorities. We focus on true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Want to take off with us and revolutionize the world of mobility? Apply now!

title: Customer Service and Order Entry
description:
**Now Hiring: Account Expeditor (Sales Support)**  

ProSource aims to help our trade pro members and their customers complete successful projects. As an Account Expeditor, you will play a vital role in helping other businesses tap into the growth solutions that ProSource can provide.  

  

We are not retail and do not operate like retail. The beauty of wholesale is that RELATIONSHIPS are our business. Your determination, charisma, and energy will make all the difference in your success. We take our job seriously, but we have fun! We don’t operate under retail hours, so you can expect a great work-life balance alongside a team that will have your back will and provide you with the tools you need to succeed.  

  

Like what you hear so far? Here’s the nitty-gritty… This position is at ProSource of Stamford. You will be paid a competitive hourly wage of $20-21 with the potential for growth opportunities within the showroom. We offer a benefits package that includes healthcare and paid time off.  

  

**What you’ll do:**  

* Deliver an exceptional customer experience by greeting and signing in all showroom visitors
* Assist our team of Account Managers by facilitating the sales process, including taking customer payments, providing the status of orders, answering customers’ questions, and signing out samples.
* Be comfortable answering the phones and asking the customer questions so that you can help direct them to the right salesperson or provide them with answers.
* Understand and explain the benefits of ProSource to trade professional prospects and homeowners, and proactively invite them into our showroom.
* Schedule appointments for showroom tours with prospective members.
* Update the showroom floor with new products and pricing.
* Work with the sales team to deliver a consistent and exceptional customer experience.
* Assist in keeping the sales area and showroom in grand-opening-ready condition.
* Build rapport with our vendors through communication regarding the orders you place with them on behalf of the Account Managers.
* Utilize the CRM system and internal software for sales entry, bookkeeping, and customer relationship management.

**You might be a great match if you have:**  

* Interest or background in Interior Design a plus
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong attention to detail
* Desire to work in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to understand and effectively communicate numerical data such as discounts, interest, commissions, and percentages
* Proficient in Microsoft Office
* A general understanding of technology and the internet (using mobile devices, apps, and internet searches)

**Who we are:**  

ProSource Wholesale is one of the largest flooring companies in the country with 145+ showrooms across the United States and Canada with new showrooms opening each year. Our showrooms are staffed by teams of professionals who are experts in residential and commercial products, and our products don't end at just flooring; we provide everything from cabinets to bathtubs and are recognized as an industry leader!  

So, if you’re up for the dare to expand your career and help grow other businesses in your community, reach out to join our ProSource family today!

title: Director of Talent Acquisition
description:
**Join the team at The Equity Project (TEP) Charter School, featured in the New York Times, The Wall Street Journal and on 60 Minutes for its revolutionary teacher salaries and its outstanding results. TEP aims to achieve educational equity for students from traditionally underserved communities by utilizing world-class teachers, while re-imagining the teaching profession as a place in which teachers prioritize their own growth—as pedagogical experts, intellectual seekers, and community leaders.**


*Watch the video below to learn more about TEP's investment in teachers.*



**About the Role**



The Director of Talent Acquisition is a dynamic leadership role that requires passion and expertise in attracting, developing, and retaining excellent people to serve our students and families. This individual oversees the development and execution of both long-range plan and short-term strategies to recruit and hire TEP teachers, social workers, leadership, and all non-instructional positions. The Director of Talent Acquisition role is for an equity-driven individual who strongly believes in TEP's revolutionary approach to attracting educational talent to underserved communities.


**Responsibilities**


***Talent Marketing, Recruitment, and Sourcing:***


* **Optimizing Talent Acquisition:** Lead TEP's Talent Acquisition recruitment process by enhancing the candidate experience across all positions and hiring stages. Spearhead targeted recruitment for teachers and non-instructional staff through participation in recruiting events, job fairs, networking, external partnerships, and leveraging TEP's talent network.
* **Talent Pipeline Development:** Maintain and expand TEP's robust pipeline of referrals from existing teachers and staff, leveraging referrals as a primary and successful mechanism for attracting strong-fit, qualified candidates to TEP.
* **Job Descriptions:** Develop high-quality job descriptions and job posts that resonate with TEP's organizational vision, ensuring alignment with the school's commitment to excellence and equity.
* **Social Media Optimization:** Maximize TEP's social media presence and employer brand across various platforms, overseeing the development and management of all marketing efforts aimed at staff recruitment to provide a dynamic and informative space for potential candidates.
* **Collaboration with School Leaders:** Work with school leaders to innovate and implement new Talent Acquisition strategies and initiatives, maximizing staff retention, and fostering effective and equitable talent acquisition and candidate assessment strategies.
* **Online Recruitment Platform Management:** Manage all online recruitment platforms, including Greenhouse (TEP's applicant tracking system) and external Job Boards, coordinating every aspect of the hiring process.


***Hiring Process Management:***


* **End-to-End Hiring Oversight:** Manage all stages of the hiring process for instructional and non-instructional positions within the TEP community, ensuring a seamless and efficient talent acquisition experience.
* **Candidate Experience Management:** Ensure a high-quality candidate experience marked by transparency, prompt follow-up, ensuring clear and consistent communication throughout the recruitment process.
* **Data-driven Talent Acquisition:** Manage all data sets related to Talent Acquisition processes, including the tracking of spending, and hiring and retention metrics to inform strategic decision-making.
* **Team Management:** Supervise and collaborate with the one (1) other member of TEP's Talent Acquisition team, who supports with all the responsibilities of this position.


**About You (Qualifications)**


* **Leadership Experience in Talent Acquisition:** Bring a minimum of 5+ years of impactful leadership experience in the talent acquisition field, demonstrating a track record of successfully attracting, developing, and retaining top-tier talent.
* **Expertise in Screening and Interviewing:** Showcase significant expertise in screening and interviewing job candidates, utilizing comprehensive Talent Acquisition strategies to identify and select the best-fit candidates for instructional and non-instructional roles.
* **Passion for Equity and Inclusion:** Exhibit a genuine passion for building diverse, equitable, and inclusive teams, aligning with TEP's commitment to fostering educational equity in every aspect of the hiring process.
* **Strategic Vision and Operational Agility:** Showcase enthusiasm for big-picture talent strategy and innovation while demonstrating the ability to adeptly navigate day-to-day operational needs within talent operations.
* **Relationship Building:** Demonstrate an ability to build rapport quickly, establishing and maintaining productive and trust-based relationships with a variety of individuals across diverse groups within the organization.
* **Commitment to TEP's Vision:** Display deep commitment to TEP's organizational vision and revolutionary approach to attracting educational talent to underserved communities, aligning personal values with TEP's mission.
* **Exceptional Communication Skills:** Exhibit exceptional writing ability and oral communication skills, essential for crafting compelling job descriptions, conducting interviews, and ensuring transparent and effective communication with candidates.


**Why TEP (Benefits)**



At TEP, growth isn't just for our students—continued growth is also a central priority for our staff members. That's why we're redefining the employee experience, offering a rewarding career that includes an annual salary that matches TEP's high expectations.


* **Compensation:** Competitive annual salary in the range of **$110K to $120K**, based on the individual's experience level
* **Unmatched Talent:** Be surrounded by a collaborative community of experienced, passionate professionals who care about educational equity
* **Time Off:** 5 weeks of vacation plus 11 federal holidays and additional non-federal holidays according to each school calendar; 5 sick days and 3 personal days
* **Guidance and Mentorship:** The Director of Talent Acquisition reports directly to TEP's CEO
* **Employee Wellness:** We value your well-being through our Staff Food Program, Staff Retreats, and Wellness Programming
* **Healthcare:** World-class medical, dental, vision, Short-Term Disability (STD), Long-Term Disability (LTD), and Life Insurance policies
* **Family Focus:** Parental leave and dependent care account so you can care for your loved ones
* **403b Retirement Plan:** We care about your ability to save for your future
* **Learning & Development:** A culture that provides and encourages professional growth and development, including professional development and tuition/continuous learning reimbursements


**Application Process**



TEP is designed and structured around the belief that great staff members are the key to achieving educational success for students. As such, we require applicants to demonstrate their qualifications throughout the application and hiring process. The requirements for each Director of Talent Acquisition applicant include:


* **Resume:** Potential candidates must submit an up-to-date resume
* **Cover Letter:** Potential candidates must submit a well-written cover letter that highlights their specific interest in joining the TEP community


TEP is currently reviewing applications on a rolling basis. If you submit both a cover letter and resume, you will receive a response from us as to whether or not you will be invited to the next stage of the process for the Director of Talent Acquisition role.

title: Overnight Corporate Security Officer - Manhattan NY
description:
Job Requirements  



  

Silverseal is an established and growing security and investigative company providing services across the nation. We are looking qualified security officers for our sites across the country.

* Former Police and Military are encouraged to apply.

  

\\*You must possess a current New York State security guard license\\*

  

\\*\\*Overnight shifts only: 11PM-7AM EST\\*\\*

  

The following are among the tasks you would be performing, if selected - On an "as needed" basis:

  

* Secure property and personnel by standing on post, scanning and controlling facilities, grounds and access points
* Indoor patrol of the premises for entire shift
* Implement and practice security procedures and protocols
* Maintain a secure and safe environment by monitoring access control systems along with fire and trespassing exits
* Strong ability to be attentive to detail and observant of surroundings
* Knowledge of operating walkie-talkie, two-way radio transceivers, and answering service calls for assistance
* Acknowledge, review, and respond to all operational alarms and security-related situations
* Utilize the Closed-Circuit Television (“CCTV”)
* Complete accurate and concise reports by recording observations, occurrences, information, and surveillance activities.
* Provide excellent customer service experience by greeting incoming guests and tenants, providing information regarding the site and surrounding area as requested by visitor
* Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain, snow, or heat
* Perform other duties assigned by supervisors related to security and safety

  


Work Experience


  

* Active New York State Security Guard License
* Be at least 18 years of age
* High School Diploma or equivalent
* Security Officers are required to stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time without sitting or kneeling
* Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
* Occasionally lift or carry up to 40 pounds
* Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
* Ability to communicate effectively by both orally and written with interpersonal skills to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner
* Ability to write accurate and concise reports for team members and supervisors
* Ability to handle stressful situations and make sound judgement calmly and effectively
* Have basic computer skills to operate various technologies across our client sites


Preferred Skills

* First Aid, CPR, AED
* Bi-lingual
* Previous law enforcement or military experience
* 60 college credits in criminal justice school

  


Benefits  



  

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

  

Pay: $17.00 - $18.00 per hour

  

Expected hours: 11PM - 7AM

title: Value Advisor- High Growth/Manufacturing- East
description:
**We help the world run better**

  

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

  



**What You’ll Do**


The Value Advisor is a strategic role supporting general industry business to grow sales, pipeline, customer adoption and satisfaction. The Value Advisor engages with senior business executives and provides a business process and industry perspective, develops business cases, and thought leadership to support sales cycles. In addition, the Advisor will drive pipeline growth and contribute to building and maintaining SAP’s leadership position and brand. This opening is focused on Consumer Industries and/or Discrete manufacturing.

  

We are looking for someone with a passion for helping organizations solve issues, create value, maximize growth and improve business performance. A typical engagement requires obtaining buy-in of key executive stakeholders, confirming scope and timeline, conducting discovery workshops, analyzing and synthesizing information, producing quality, executive ready deliverables with the ability to articulate work in a compelling and effective manner.

 *Responsibilities & Objectives:*

* Collaborate with the C-Suite and other senior executives at our customers to drive the case for change.
* Develop and present case for change to the Executive Suite.
* Understand situational interpretations and analyze data to identify and understand challenges.
* Demonstrate expert knowledge critical to the role, such as, developing business cases and related metrics while utilizing both traditional and modern assessment tools, such as interviews, surveys, and evaluations.
* Lead complex engagements with cross-functional teams (internal and external).
* Grow the Value Advisory practice by improving on current practices / adding to it.
* Successfully pitch value engagements to customers.
* Contribute to internal account strategy discussions in a meaningful fashion.

 **What You Bring**

 ***Key Attributes:***

* 5 years of relevant experience preferred either as a practitioner, management consultant, or an operational consultant.
* Must be a creative storyteller.
* Aptitude for analytical and creative thinking.
* Ability to work in an ambiguous environment.
* Proficient speaker comfortable interacting with customers one to one and / or one to many scenarios.
* Possess a strong executive presence.
* Ability to establish and maintain strong relationships and to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal (both internally and externally).
* High Growth/Manufacturing industry background
* Experience in diverse technology landscape and process/technology, SAP background is a plus.
* Understanding of cloud software operating model

 ***Qualifications:***

* Executive presence demonstrated by excellent and energetic public speaking skills.
* Passion for technology. SAP technology knowledge is a bonus.
* Proven CXO engagement skills.
* Ability to produce storylines and high-quality presentations in PowerPoint with a very keen eye for detail. Comfortable with doing financial analysis in excel spreadsheets.
* Product marketing acumen (segment, target, content, lead strategy).
* Positive, Motivated, Self-starter with a can-do attitude
* Participation in relevant industry associations is a strong positive.
* MBA preferred

 **Meet Your Team**

* Digital transformation leader profile with ~ 50% travel
* This is an elite team with high visibility and exposure to SAP and Customer leadership
* Flexible work environment
* Culture of trust and teamwork
* Learning never stops
* SAP is an equal opportunity employer

  

Candidate(s) will be required to work 3 days a week in office/client site as per our Pledge to Flex return to office policy

 **SAP is not offering relocation benefits for this role at this time.**

**SAP is not offering visa sponsorship for this role at this time.**

  



**Bring out your best**


SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

 **We win with inclusion**


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

 **EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability**


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.

 **Compensation Range Transparency**: SAP believes the value of pay transparency contributes towards an honest and supportive culture and is a significant step toward demonstrating SAP’s commitment to pay equity. SAP provides the annualized compensation range inclusive of base salary and variable incentive target for the career level applicable to the posted role. The targeted combined range for this position is 132,000 - 281,400 USD. The actual amount to be offered to the successful candidate will be within that range, dependent upon the key aspects of each case which may include education, skills, experience, scope of the role, location, etc. as determined through the selection process. Any SAP variable incentive includes a targeted dollar amount and any actual payout amount is dependent on company and personal performance. Please reference this link for a summary of SAP benefits and eligibility requirements: SAP North America Benefits.

description:

**Position Summary**Summary:
  

The Patient Care Associate (PCA) is a specially trained member of the Nursing Department who provides assistance to either the RN or LPN in delivery of selected aspects of patient care. The Patient Care Associate understands and complies with the Philosophy, Standards, Objectives and Policies of the Department. The Patient Care Associate obtains blood specimens and assists in other tasks as needed.
**Qualifications**Responsibilities:
  

**Education Required**  

* Must complete in-house orientation program
* High School Diploma or equivalent.
* At least one of the following:
* Successful completion of an approved Nursing Assistant training program OR equivalent based on established criteria
* Successful completion of an approved Patient Care Technician training program
* Successful completion of Mount Sinai South Nassau Student Nurse Intern Program (300 hours)
* Successful completion of 2 semesters of hospital-based clinical practicum while enrolled in an accredited nursing program
* Completion of Support Staff Orientation (Mount Sinai South Nassau).

  

**Experience And Skills**  

* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Speaks, reads and writes English
* Completion of 2 clinicals (with patient in the acute care setting) while enrolled in a Nursing program, if not trained as a Patient Care Technician.
* Technical skills required for patient care.
* Completion of a phlebotomy course/competency or successful completion of MSSN phlebotomy training within 90 days of hire.
* Good verbal and written communication skills.
* Good interpersonal skills.
* Requires manual dexterity.
* Basic Computer Skills

  

**License/Certifications**  

* CPI
* BLS
**Working Conditions**Other information:
  

**Working Conditions**  

* Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) worn
* Lifts, positions and/or transfers patients/equipment
* Protective clothing/equipment worn

title: Finance Manager
description:
Description  

Kenvue is currently recruiting for:


**Finance Manager**



This position reports into the US Essential Health Senior Manager and will be located at Skillman, NJ.


**Who we are**



At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including Neutrogena, Aveeno, Tylenol, Listerine, Johnson’s and BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent. Our global team is made up of ~ 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact the life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours.


**Role reports to:** US Essential Health Senior Manager


**Location:** Skillman, NJ Kenvue’s corporate headquarters is currently located in Skillman NJ, but is scheduled to move to Summit, NJ in or around early 2025.
**Travel %:** 10%, primarily North America
**Pay**: $97,000-$166,750  


**What you will do**


The Finance Manager will provide financial leadership to the Oral Care business by evaluating sales and marketing investment opportunities for growth, collaborating cross-functionally to evaluate pipeline innovation opportunities, and proactively making recommendations to manage short and long-term financial commitments. The Finance Manager will lead the Oral Care monthly IBP cycles and all financial forecasts. Finally, the position will supervise one Senior Financial Analyst and reports to the US Essential Health Senior Manager.

  




Responsibilities:


* Provide strategic financial leadership for iconic business including Sales and P&L Forecasting, New Product Evaluation, P&L Reporting and Analysis, Brand Marketing Expense Management
* Lead the Integrated Business Planning process for business each month by actively contributing to Demand Reviews, driving alignment between Sales, Marketing and Operations and delivering a monthly forecast.
* Analytical and strategic support for enterprise decision making in partnership with Local Marketing, Sales, Demand Planning, Project Management, and Global Marketing counterparts.
* Support of full marketing P&L management in collaboration with cross-functional partners, including ongoing assessments of risks vs. opportunities.
* Brand Marketing Expense management and investment optimization to support our forecast commitments.
* Direct partnership with category leads for sales forecasting and budgeting.
* Providing timely and accurate cost and financial information related to forecasts, new products, and budgets.
* Ad hoc support for projects, presentations, and process improvement initiatives with both finance and cross-functional management.

Qualifications **What we are looking for**


Required Qualifications
* Bachelors degree required.
* Minimum of 5+ years of Finance/Accounting work experience required.
* Excellent analytical skills, superior communication, business partnering, problem solving, and prioritization skills required.

  



Desired Qualifications
* CPA, CMA, MBA preferred.
* 5+ years at the Finance Management level preferred.
* Ability to succeed in a matrixed, cross-functional environment and across all levels of the organization needed.
* Self-motivated individual with demonstrated leadership, ability to work with senior management, people management and development skills preferred.
* High potential, high performing individual needed that has proven track record of delivering results and successfully influencing business partners.
* Strong people development skills required as individual is expected to be key driver of Finance organizational initiatives across the business unit

  


**What’s in it for you**


* Competitive Total Rewards Package\\*
* Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Volunteer Time & More!
* Learning & Development Opportunities
* Employee Resource Groups

  


* Note: Total Rewards at Kenvue include salary, bonus (if applicable) and benefits. Your Talent Access Partner will be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the recruitment & hiring process.

  



Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

  




#vdh

description:

**Status** **:** Full Time Regular
**Shift:** 10 HOUR DAY SHIFT
**Department:** Interventional Radiology
**Position Summary**Summary:
  

The Special Procedures Technologist assists the physician in the performance of procedures conducted in Interventional Radiology. The Special Procedures Technologist demonstrates the proficiency in the performance of examinations and operation of equipment in all locations including Main Radiology Department, Emergency Room X-ray area, portable/mobile units, fluoroscopic units, mobile fluoroscopic units (c-arms), O.R. Cysto Room.
**Qualifications**Responsibilities:
  

**Education Required**  

* Must complete in-house orientation program
* Graduate of A.M.A. approved Radiologic Technology program.

  

**Experience And Skills**  

* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Speaks, reads and writes English

  

* At least 1 years of Radiologic Technologist experience required.

  

* 2 –3 years’ experience in Interventional Radiology imaging preferred.

  

**License/Certifications**  

* American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) certification or equivalent, preferred and registration in the pertinent discipline
* Holds current New York State Department of Health certificate of registration as a Radiologic Technologist.

  

**Working Conditions**Other information:
  

**Working Conditions**  

  

* Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) worn

  

* Standing: Particularly for sustained periods of time.

  

* Pushing: Using upper extremities to press against something with steady force in order to thrust forward, downward or outward.

  

* Pulling: Using upper extremities to exert force in order to draw haul or tug objects in a sustained motion.

  

* Heavy work: Exerting up to 100 pounds of force occasionally, &/or in excess of 50 lbs. of force frequently &/or 20 lbs. of force constantly to move objects.

title: Lead Analyst Digital Adoption
description:
Description  

Kenvue is currently recruiting for:  

**Lead Analyst, Digital Adoption**

  

**Who we are**  

At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including Neutrogena, Aveeno, Tylenol, Listerine, Johnson’s and BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent. Our global team is made up of ~ 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact the life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours.



Role reports to: Sr. Manager Digital Adoption  

Location: Skillman, NJ (Kenvue’s corporate headquarters is currently located in Skillman NJ, but is scheduled to move to Summit, NJ in or around early 2025.)  

Travel : 10%  

Pay: 88,000- 142,600


**What you will do**  

As a Lead Analyst, Digital Adoption you will play a critical role in driving Digital Transformation within Kenvue by shaping and executing a robust Change Management & Digital Adoption strategy for the Digital Transformation Office.


* Develop & execute adoption strategies for each digital capability considering the regional and functional nuances.
* Create innovative ways to improve adoption of new and existing digital products based on user experience. Well-versed in data analytics and creating meaningful insights followed by targeted actions to drive adoption at regional and functional levels.
* Create strong partnership with Digital Capability Owners, Product Owners, and business stakeholders to enhance outcomes on digital adoption and reinforce collaborative ways of working through effective stakeholder management
* Continuously drive improvements in Digital Adoption Platform content, deployment processes, and maturity.
* Oversee the technical development and deployment of Digital Adoption Platform content by internal and external build teams.
* Define key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure adoption and enhance stakeholder experience to achieve overall business outcomes.
* Develop and implement relevant Change Management strategies to enable impacted teams to successfully adopt cutting-edge digital products and solutions.
* Identify risks and develop plans to mitigate them.
* Define communications strategy and develop necessary communications assets in alignment with regional and functional teams to ensure all impacted teams understand the reasons for change and how it will affect them.

Qualifications **What we are looking for**  

Required Qualifications  

* A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree is required.
* Must have 6+ years of business experience driving or leading Change Management, Digital Adoption, Communications, and Training for transformational programs. Specialization in executing Digital Adoption in Supply Chain is strongly preferred.
* Expert in providing comprehensive executive reporting including analysis of data and KPIs on adoption of digital products and solutions and suggesting deeper insights to improve utilization of digital products. Should be able to implement specific actions with stakeholders accelerating the overall Adoption /Change Management efforts.
* Capable of driving adoption effectively in collaboration with internal teams leveraging stakeholder management experience, superior influencing and interpersonal skills.
* Experienced in defining and delivering all components of Organizational Change Management end-to-end.
* Expert in leveraging latest communication vehicles and channels to cascade relevant messages to internal and external Stakeholders.
* Experienced in developing relevant training material to support successful adoption of new tools and ways of working.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills, including an ability to work with individuals from various geographies, business departments, and levels of the organization


Desired Qualifications  

* Change Management certification (e.g., Prosci or CCMP Certified Change Management Practitioner) strongly preferred
* Knowledge of Digital Adoption Platform will be beneficial.
* Experience in driving adoption of applications and tools is strongly preferred.
* Should be well versed in developing training content and leveraging latest tools and technologies to deliver training effectively as per the need.
* Good understanding of project and program management tools and techniques, including agile principles

**What’s in it for you**  

* Annual base salary for new hires in this position ranges from $88,000 to $ 142,600 This takes into account a number of factors including work location, the candidate’s skills, experience, education level & other job-related factors.
* Competitive Total Rewards Package\\*
* Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Volunteer Time & More!
* Learning & Development Opportunities
* Employee Resource Groups
* This list could vary based on location/region

* Note: Total Rewards at Kenvue include salary, bonus (if applicable) and benefits. Your Talent Access Partner will be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the recruitment & hiring process.



Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Associate Manager, Customer Strategy
description:
Description  

Kenvue is currently recruiting for:


**Associate Manager, Customer Strategy**


**Who we are**



At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including Neutrogena, Aveeno, Tylenol, Listerine, Johnson’s and BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent. Our global team is made up of ~ 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact the life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours.

  

**Role reports to:** Senior Manager Customer Strategy Face Care


**Location:** Skillman, NJ


**Travel :** 20%


**Pay:** 88,000- 142,600

  


**What you will do**



The Customer Strategy Analyst is responsible for enabling the achievement of forecast and the brand objectives for the US & Canada through instituting strategic business plans that integrate, align, and achieve customer and Kenvue business goals. You will lead the planning process and plays a meaningful role in influencing go-to-market strategies, own the new-item launch process for assigned brand(s), and coordinates the customer specific marketing efforts. Serve as a liaison between Sales and Marketing by providing “voice of customer” to Marketing and by providing knowledge of marketing and brand strategies to the field. Provide in-depth analytics and insights for the team and customers. Special projects are an integral part of this role and the ideal person should be comfortable operating in a dynamic, fast past environment. Key responsibilities in addition to 6P excellence include, but are not limited to:



Key Responsibilities:



Business Planning


* Leads business planning process by developing analytics & insights to support marketing strategy, trade fundamentals, channel strategies and Ecommerce growth. Effective in preparing timelines, communication of the process, and conducting collaborative planning cycles with customer teams.


* Communicates & coordinates key strategies, insights, and initiatives between field and internal teams as well as gains alignment across a matrix environment to support goal achievement.


* Partners with internal team members to develop and execute the revenue growth management strategies in order to drive top and bottom-line growth.

  



Analytics


* Leads cross-functional team members in development, evaluation, & implementation of the 6Ps by evaluating trends, developing insights, & translates findings to drive business performance improvement both internally & externally.


* Influences business processes and requirements related to pricing, trade promotions, Ecommerce development, category management, & inventory management including cross-functional collaboration with marketing, supply chain, trade, and finance on forecasting to sales input across responsible brands.


* Develops and ensure the execution of all trade related expenses while evaluating other elements of all BME related activities to improve P&L performance, including tracking & influencing using LYNX and PRF systems to ensure trade funding is maximized within allocated investment.


* Creates & influences assortment & merchandising recommendations for both Brick and Mortar and Ecommerce.



Customer Team Engagement


* Coordinates & conducts regular communication sessions between internal cross functional and sales teams to ensure alignment and accountability on forecast attainment, budget, business planning, and trade objectives with immediacy via a Customer Service based model.


* Provides support and insight for retailer business & new item reviews.


* Co-leads key top to top customer meetings with sales teams.


* Develops and presents customer, category and brand reviews to drive brand and category performance.


* Ensures execution of plans through regular communication and interaction with the customer team and in-store visits.

Qualifications **What we are looking for**


Required Qualifications
* A Bachelor’s degree is required.
* A minimum of 2 years prior experience in direct customer sales, business analytics, and/or customer marketing is required.
* Ability to travel up to 20%

  



Desired Qualifications
* Prior beauty/Skin Health category experience preferred.
* Ability to work effectively within a fast-paced, complex matrix, changing environment.
* Demonstrate effective communication and negotiation skills. Strong presentation skills and ability to tailor skills and presentation style to a variety of key decision makers.
* Ability to devise and deliver persuasive presentations, based on data-driven insights and facts, to gain support for business strategies and/or initiatives.
* Ability to develop and oversee the execution of project plans and to implement, execute and draw conclusions from a variety of customer, shopper and category studies.

title: Transportation Supervisor
description:
About dnata:

dnata is a global leader in air services, operating in 127 airports across 35 countries. Since 1959, we've been ensuring smooth and efficient aviation operations worldwide. Our comprehensive services include ground handling, cargo, travel, and flight catering, serving over 300 airline customers and handling 1,900+ flights daily.

Join Our Team:

We're seeking a talented Transportation Supervisor to join our Inwood, NY team supporting JFK International Airport. At dnata, we value our employees and invest in their growth through training and mentoring. We offer opportunities to work across our national network and be part of a dynamic, global organization.

Role Overview:

The Transportation Supervisor manages all transportation department personnel during their shift, ensuring flights are serviced and catered to meet customer requirements and prevent aircraft departure delays. This role requires attentiveness to last-minute changes and excellent communication skills.

Key Responsibilities:

- Manage transportation staff to meet customer satisfaction goals

- Optimize vehicle and personnel scheduling

- Maintain relationships with maintenance department

- Produce shift reports and manage documentation

- Monitor flight schedules and coordinate driver activities

- Ensure compliance with safety, security, and food handling procedures

- Conduct safety audits and investigate workplace incidents

- Collaborate with internal departments and customers

Qualifications:

- High school diploma or GED with 2+ years of related experience

- CDL License Class A or B (Required)

- Airport experience (Required)

- Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel

- Ability to pass background checks for airport security clearance

- Flexible schedule availability

- Strong communication and problem-solving skills

Physical Demands:

- Ability to lift/move up to 30 pounds regularly

- Comfortable working in various weather conditions

- Standing, walking, and other physical activities required

Compensation and Benefits:

- Salary: $65,000 annually (base pay)

- Weekly pay schedule

- Comprehensive benefits package including:

- 401(k) with company match

- Health, dental, and vision insurance

Join dnata and be part of a team that's shaping the future of aviation services. Apply now to start your journey with us!

title: Communications Manager
description:
**Organization Summary:** Prep for Prep is an education and leadership development program that develops ethical and effective leaders who reflect our diverse society. Prep identifies New York City's most promising students of color, prepares them for success at the nation's top independent schools throughout the Northeast, and supports their academic and personal growth through college graduation. Today, over 5,000 students and alumni in the Prep for Prep Community are leaders in every field imaginable.

**Position Summary:** We are seeking a Communications Manager to join our three-person Communications Office. The Communications Manager will collaborate with Communications team members and colleagues in other departments to develop and implement a comprehensive, strategic plan for all Prep for Prep communications and branding, including social media, website, print, and outreach to various stakeholders and constituencies. The ideal candidate is a communications generalist with experience across the full range of communications activities, a stellar project manager, and a strong writer and editor. The ideal candidate will be both a big-picture strategic and creative thinker and a doer willing to take on large and small tasks to achieve shared goals.

This full-time, exempt position reports to the Director of Communications. This position is based in Prep for Prep’s West 71st Street office.

Responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to, the following:

**Strategic Communications Planning**

* Collaborate with the Director of Communications to develop and implement comprehensive communications plans that reflect and advance Prep for Prep’s mission.
* In collaboration with the Director of Communication, plan and create written and visual content for Prep’s communications channels.
* Liaise with the organization’s Development, Admissions, Alumni Affairs, and other departments to support their communications needs.

**Website and Social Media** **Management**

* Develop and implement social media campaigns to meet the communications and marketing needs for student recruitment, donor and alumni engagement, and positioning Prep as a leader in its field.
* Monitor social media (comments, direct messaging), collect and report on analytics, and maintain social, editorial, and key-messaging calendars to spot trends and keep ahead of issues.
* Assist in updating and maintaining the organization’s website, optimize content for SEO, and ensure a positive user experience.

**Content Creation and Publication Management**

* Produce in-house communications and marketing materials to support donor cultivation, solicitation, and stewardship; engagement of alumni, schools, and corporate partnerships; and student/family recruitment.
* Create compelling, mission-focused content for the organization’s website, social media channels, annual report, and other publications.
* Capture photography and videography, edit and customize for social media, the website, and in-house materials.
* Attend program events and photo and video shoots to provide in-house photography needs and production assistance.
* Using an email marketing tool (currently MailChimp), create and schedule emails to support fundraising efforts, organization awareness, and event attendance.
* Provide design assistance for marketing materials such as brochures, banners, infographics, and other visual assets.

**Skills, Experience, and Competencies**

* Bachelor’s degree required.
* Minimum three years of experience in communications, journalism, marketing, public relations, or related field. Experience in a nonprofit or educational setting is preferred.
* Strong written and oral communication skills, with an ability to adapt content to different audiences.
* Experience developing short- and long-term communication strategies
* Excellent attention to detail and copyediting and proofreading skills; knowledge of Chicago Manual Style a plus.
* Proven track record managing social media channels for an organization.
* Skilled at relationship-building and comfortable engaging with various stakeholders and media outlets
* Working knowledge of digital photography and videography
* Proficiency with social media platforms (Instagram, LinkedIn, and X), website CMS, and Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Slides).
* Working knowledge of Hootsuite, email marketing platforms, productivity (Asana and Slack), and database and customer relationship software (Filemaker and Salesforce) is a plus.
* Ability to exercise discretion and good judgment in handling confidential information and in alignment with organizational objectives.
* Ability to work collaboratively and independently in a fast-paced, high-expectation environment.
* Cultural competence in working with diverse constituents, including alumni, donors, trustees, program participants, and other stakeholders
* Fluency in reading and writing Spanish and/or Chinese is a plus.

**Working Conditions**

* This is a hybrid position, with three days in office and two days remote. However, depending on the department's needs, this role may be required to work in-person more than three days per week.
* Occasional evening or weekend work may be required around major events.

**Compensation**The annual base salary range is $70,000 to $80,000.

**How to Apply:** Please email a cover letter, resume, and three writing samples to personnel@prepforprep.org and ameadows@prepforprep.org. Use the subject line “Communications Manager.”

*Prep for Prep is an equal opportunity employer.*

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Work Location: In person

title: Program Manager
description:
Are you both tech-savvy and hands-on? Can you diagnose a computer problem then fix it? Problem-solver, self-motivated, good communicator? If so, you could find your fit on the Call Center Desktop Applications team at Spectrum.  

At Spectrum, we keep more than 32 million customers connected across our 41-state footprint. Our Call Center Desktop Apps team support team helps maintain the company’s information technology (IT) infrastructure in support of our customers and call center employees. By keeping our hardware and software updated and running smoothly 24/7, our Desktop & IT support team helps deliver the exceptional services and experiences Spectrum is known for. **BE PART OF THE CONNECTION**  

As a **Program Manager** on the Call Center Desktop Applications team, you’ll be a part of the digital transformation projects. You’ll use your extensive project management experience to manage multiple projects within highly complex or enterprise-wide programs. You’ll ensure successful integration of projects and adjust project scope, timing, and budgets based on business needs. **WHAT OUR PROGRAM MANAGERS ENJOY MOST*** Developing program strategies that support business cases and various high-level project plans
* Serving as a mentor to project managers and project leaders to educate and assist them with processes and improvements
* Ensuring the use of established project management processes and methodologies to deliver on project scope while meeting or exceeding quality standards
* Directing and reviewing plans and teamwork assignments, escalating resource needs, ensuring completion of quality reviews, and driving issue resolution
* Communicating program strategy, direction, and changes to leadership and other stakeholders
* Partnering with leadership from the business community to identify and prioritize opportunities to achieve enterprise goals

  

You’ll work in a fast-paced, high-impact office environment. You’ll thrive in this role if you can work both collaboratively and independently, show judgement and initiative to accomplish goals, and are energized by the challenges of an ever-evolving category. **WHAT YOU’LL BRING TO SPECTRUM** *Required Qualifications** **Experience:** Project Management experience: 7 years or more
* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree in business administration or related field, or equivalent experience
* **Abilities:** Work independently with no supervision and guidance; communicate clearly both orally and in writing; define key performance indicators/metrics; effectively analyze and interpret data; document, prepare, and deliver data-driven presentations; influence internal and external key stakeholders and build consensus; conduct risk assessments and develop mitigation plans; manage complex program and project budgets

 *Preferred Qualifications** **Education:** Project Management certification or successful completion of a recognized project management curriculum

 **SPECTRUM CONNECTS YOU TO MORE*** **Dynamic Growth:** The growth of our industry and evolving technology powers our employees’ careers as they move up or around the company
* **Tools & Tech:** Work with leading broadband network services and high-performing products on the forefront of the telecommunications industry
* **Learning Culture:** We invest in your learning, and provide paid training and coaching to help you succeed
* **Supportive Teams:** Be part of a strong community that gives you opportunities to network and grow, and wants to see you succeed
* **Total Rewards:** See all the ways we invest in you—at work and in life

 *Apply now, connect a friend to this opportunity or* *sign up for job alerts**!*  


KGN312 2024-38357 2024
  

  

Here, employees don’t just have jobs, they build careers. That’s why we believe in offering a comprehensive pay and benefits package that rewards employees for their contributions to our success, supports all aspects of their well-being, and delivers real value at every stage of life.  

  

A qualified applicant’s criminal history, if any, will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable laws, including local ordinances.

When you join us, you’re joining a strong community of more than 100,000 individuals working together to serve more than 32 million customers in 41 states and keep them connected to what matters most. title: Part-Time Store Cashier/Stocker
description:
Enhance the ALDI customer shopping experience in a collaborative team environment as an ALDI Cashier or Stocker. As a member of our team, you’ll be operating the registers or other machinery, stocking our shelves, keeping our stores looking their best, and serving our customers. Start a job that offers up something new each day.

* Provides exceptional customer service, assisting customers with their shopping experience
